title: Investigation of Early Stage Lithium Growth Behaviors Using Cryo-TEM
content: Lithium metal batteries, renowned for their high energy density, face significant hurdles due to dendritic or whisker growth of lithium during electrochemical plating. This phenomenon leads to capacity fading from substantial SEI loss and dead lithium formation, and safety hazards like short circuits [1]. Despite extensive research aiming to modify lithium growth behaviors and enhance performance [2], a lack of fundamental understanding regarding lithium growth mechanisms hampers innovative lithium metal battery development. Particularly, early-stage lithium growth behavior remains poorly understood due to experimental technique limitations.
